dataset.title: MCR LTER: Coral Reef: Estimates of component primary production and respiration, ongoing since 2006

abstract.para: Estimates of primary production and respiration of three representative components of the Moorea coral reef ecosystem are made yearly in a laboratory flume. The components are: algal turf communities, the macroalga Sargassum pacificum, and the common branching coral Pocillopora verrucosa. Metabolism estimates are made using changes in dissolved oxygen over time in a flume in unidirectional flow at saturating irradiances and dark. Rates are normalized to projected (planar) surface area (all components) and biomass (algal turfs, Sargassum).

keywordSet.keyword: Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station

intellectualRights.para:
Data collected under the auspices of the MCR LTER are available to the public after primary publication, or at most two years after the completion of the study unless proprietary restrictions are warranted. Use of MCR LTER data is subject to acceptance of the following conditions:
1. The user agrees to provide valid name and contact information prior to downloading online data. This information will be used to contact the user in case of changes to the data, and may also be used by data set authors and MCR LTER project administrators to document data usage.
2. The user agrees to cite the data set author and MCR LTER in all publications in which the data are used, as per the instructions in the data documentation. If no specific instructions are provided in the data documentation, the user is requested to include the following statement: "Data sets were provided by the Moorea Coral Reef Ecosystem LTER, funded by the US National Science Foundation (OCE-0417412)."
3. The user agrees to provide one copy of any manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the data set author prior to submitting it for publication.
4. The user agrees to send two hard copies of any published manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the following address: Dr. Andrew J. Brooks Deputy Program Director, MCR LTER Marine Science Institute University of California Santa Barbara, CA 93106-6150 The user also agrees to send one electronic copy (pdf format) to the following e-mail address: brooks@msi.ucsb.edu
5. Users are prohibited from selling or redistributing any data provided by MCR LTER without explicit prior permission.
6. Users are encouraged to contact original investigators responsible for data. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on MCR LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
7. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and the MCR LTER will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.
8. Any violation of the terms of this agreement will result in immediate forfeiture of the data and loss of access privileges to other MCR LTER data sets.

maintenance.description: This is an ongoing dataset. Experiments are repeated each year. Data are appended after analysis.

changeHistory.comment: With revision 9 the values in the GPP column are revised for all years. Taxonomy updated. Table format revised.
With revision 10 the single table is split into a table for each component to allow more granular column description.
as of 2012 output has come out of R program

section.title: Sampling Locations:
section.para: Organisms are collected from the backreef zone of reefs on the north shore of Moorea.

section.title: Taxa:
section.para:
Three representative benthic coral reef cover components:
Algal turfs of multiple species
The macroalga Sargassum pacificum (formerly known as S. mangarevense)
The branching coral Pocillopora verrucosa

section.title: Sampling:
section.para: All organisms are collected from the backreef on the north shore of Moorea. Algal turf communities used have developed on coral plates (10 x 10 x 1.5 cm) cut from skeletons of the coral Porites lobata/lutea. Plates are attached to racks bolted to the backreef at depths of 1-2 m. Algal turf communities have been established on the plates for >9-12 months. Sargassum pacificum individuals are removed with the holdfast intact from bommies on the backreef. Small colonies (approximately 10 cm in diameter) of Pocillopora verrucosa are collected intact from the backreef. All samples (n=10 for each) are returned in seawater to the lab and kept in running seawater tables at ambient light until metabolism measurements are made (< 24 h). Each experiment estimates the rate of change in dissolved oxygen over a 30-60 minute incubation in the flume at saturating irradiances (for primary production) or in the dark (respiration). Flow in the flume is unidirectional at a velocity of 23 cm/s. Rates are normalized to planar area based on measured areas (algal turfs) or digital photographs taken from above the flume (Sargassum, Pocillopora). Rates are also provided normalized to ash free dry mass for algal turfs and to dry mass for Sargassum.

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Biological Sciences, California State University
Department of Biological Sciences, California State University

dataTable.entityName: Lab Flume Primary Production and Respiration for Turf
dataTable.entityDescription: Respiration, Net Primary Production, and Gross Primary Production for one of three benthic reef components as measured in a flume in the lab each year. This table includes algal turf only.
dataTable.additionalInfo: This data table is in comma-separated-value format. It can be read by Excel or any text editor and is suitable for loading into R.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date of measurement, in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
Benthic reef component (Algal Turf, Sargassum, or Coral).

codeDefinition.definition: Sargassum pacificum, formerly known as S. mangarevense, a macroalgae.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number assigned to each replicate.
Measured Planar Area in square meters of turf sample.
Ash free dry weight in grams of the turf sample.
Slope of oxygen versus time curve, in the dark, per liter. Multiply by 41 liter tank volumne to get mg/s.
Pearsons correllation coeficient, r-squared, for line fit to dark curve.
Slope of oxygen versus time curve, in the light, per liter. Multiply by 41 liter tank volumne to get mg/s.
Pearsons correllation coeficient, r-squared, for line fit to light curve.
Respiration per area defined as grams oxygen production per planar area per hour in dark. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume in the dark per area per hour.
Respiration per mass defined as grams oxygen production per gram dry weight per hour, in dark. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume in the dark per gram per hour.

Net primary production per area defined as grams oxygen production per square meter planar area per hour, in the light. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume at saturating irradiances (in light) per area.

Net primary production per area defined as grams oxygen production per gram dry weight per hour, in the light. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume at saturating irradiances (in light) per mass.
GPP = ABS(Respiration) + NPP
GPP = ABS(Respiration) + NPP

dataTable.entityName: Lab Flume Primary Production and Respiration for Sargassum
dataTable.entityDescription: Respiration, Net Primary Production, and Gross Primary Production for one of three benthic reef components as measured in a flume in the lab each year. This table includes Sargassum only.
dataTable.additionalInfo: This data table is in comma-separated-value format. It can be read by Excel or any text editor and is suitable for loading into R.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date of measurement, in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
Benthic reef component (Algal Turf, Sargassum, or Coral).

codeDefinition.definition: Sargassum pacificum, formerly known as S. mangarevense, a macroalgae.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number assigned to each replicate.
Planar Area in square meters of sargassum sample, measured with digital photo taken from above.
Dry weight in grams of the Sargassum sample.
Slope of oxygen versus time curve, in the dark, per liter. Multiply by 41 liter tank volumne to get mg/s.
Pearsons correllation coeficient, r-squared, for line fit to dark curve.
Slope of oxygen versus time curve, in the light, per liter. Multiply by 41 liter tank volumne to get mg/s.
Pearsons correllation coeficient, r-squared, for line fit to light curve.
Respiration per area defined as grams oxygen production per planar area per hour in dark. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume in the dark per area per hour.
Respiration per mass defined as grams oxygen production per gram dry weight per hour, in dark. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume in the dark per gram per hour.

Net primary production per area defined as grams oxygen production per square meter planar area per hour, in the light. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume at saturating irradiances (in light) per area.

Net primary production per area defined as grams oxygen production per gram dry weight per hour, in the light. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume at saturating irradiances (in light) per mass.
GPP = ABS(Respiration) + NPP
GPP = ABS(Respiration) + NPP

dataTable.entityName: Lab Flume Primary Production and Respiration for Coral
dataTable.entityDescription: Respiration, Net Primary Production, and Gross Primary Production for one of three benthic reef components as measured in a flume in the lab each year. This table includes Pocillopora only.
dataTable.additionalInfo: This data table is in comma-separated-value format. It can be read by Excel or any text editor and is suitable for loading into R.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date of measurement, in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
Benthic reef component (Algal Turf, Sargassum, or Coral).

codeDefinition.definition: Sargassum pacificum, formerly known as S. mangarevense, a macroalgae.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Number assigned to each replicate.
Planar area in square meters, measured with digital photo taken from above.
Number of primary branches used to calculate total area.
Number of secondary branches (branches of branches) used to calculate total area.
Area in square meters calculated from measured area and algorithm using numbers of branches. Also called real area.
Slope of oxygen versus time curve, in the dark, per liter. Multiply by 41 liter tank volumne to get mg/s.
Pearsons correllation coeficient, r-squared, for line fit to dark curve.
Slope of oxygen versus time curve, in the light, per liter. Multiply by 41 liter tank volumne to get mg/s.
Pearsons correllation coeficient, r-squared, for line fit to light curve.
Respiration per area defined as grams oxygen production per planar area per hour, in the dark. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume in the dark per area per hour. Uses planar area.

Respiration per area defined as grams oxygen production per total real area per hour, in the dark. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume in the dark per area per hour. Uses calculated total area.

Net primary production per area defined as grams oxygen production per planar area per hour, in the light. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume at saturating irradiances (in light) per area. Uses planar area.

Net primary production per area defined as grams oxygen production per planar area per hour, in the light. Rate of change in dissolved oxygen in the flume at saturating irradiances (in light) per area. Uses calculated total area.

attribute.attributeLabel: Gross Primary Production per planar area (g/m2/h)
attribute.attributeDefinition: GPP = ABS(Respiration) + NPP

attribute.attributeLabel: Gross Primary Production per total area (g/m2/h)
attribute.attributeDefinition: GPP = ABS(Respiration) + NPP

ns2:unit.name: dimensionless
ns2:unit.ns2:description: a designation asserting the absence of an associated unit
